title: Fuels Tax - Reporting
text_content:
If you have a fuels tax license, you may have to file fuel activity information monthly to DMV. Fuels tax licensees required to report activity in Virginia must submit monthly fuel activity information electronically.
Whether you are required to submit fuel activity information or not, you are required to maintain a record of your fuel activity and DMV may inspect your records.
Who must file a report?
Aviation consumer
Blender
Bulk user of alternative fuel
Distributor
Fuel alcohol provider
Importer
Motor fuel transporter
Provider of alternative fuel
Retailer of alternative fuel
Supplier
Terminal operator
When is the fuel activity information due?
Fuel activity information must be submitted by the 20th day of the second month after the activity month, with one exception: Fuel activity for the month of May must be submitted by the last day DMV is open for business in June.
How do you file?
All returns are required to be filed electronically using VAETS. In VAETS, you may manually input your monthly fuel activity or use an EDI (ASCII or EDIX12) filing format to upload activity information. You can find more information about filing in VAETS at
VAETS Training Materials and Resources
.
